A wise old owl saw them quarrel and came to help. The owl said, "Why don't you both draw together?" Tim and Ron liked the idea. They stopped quarreling and started to draw. Tim drew slow circles, while Ron drew fast lines. They made a beautiful picture with the pastel chalk and became happy friends again.

A funny squirrel saw the pepper and picked it up. He put it on his shoulder and started to dance. Lucy laughed and clapped her hands. "Silly squirrel," she said, "you have a spicy pepper on your shoulder!"
The squirrel sneezed too, and the pepper fell off his shoulder. Lucy's mom came over and said, "See, Lucy? Spicy things can make everyone sneeze. Let's leave the peppers alone and go play on the swings." Lucy agreed, and they had a fun day at the park.

A kind man in the ancient car saw Tim and stopped. He helped Tim up and said, "Little boy, remember not to rush. It's not good to be too fast." Tim learned his lesson. He knew that rushing is not always good.
The moral of the story is that we should not rush in life. It's better to be slow and steady.

Tom and Mia are twins. They are three years old. Today is their birthday. They are very happy. They wear new clothes and hats. They have a big cake with candles.
"Happy birthday, Tom and Mia!"

A few hours later, their mom came home. She saw the bowls of sugar in the backyard. She was angry.
"Who did this?" she shouted. "This is a waste of sugar and a mess to clean up!"
She went inside to find Ben and Mia. They were playing with their toys in their room. They heard their mom's voice and looked at each other.
"Uh-oh," they said. "We are in trouble."

A little boy named Tim saw a big red balloon. He wanted to hold it. Tim asked the balloon man, "Can I have the big red balloon, please?" The balloon man said, "Yes, you can, but be careful not to release it!"
Tim held the balloon tight, but then something unexpected happened. A tiny bird flew by and pecked the balloon. "Pop!" The balloon burst, and the bird flew away. Tim was sad, but then he saw a big rainbow in the sky. The rainbow made him smile, and he forgot about the balloon.

A little girl named Lisa had an idea. She took her ice cream and walked up to the frog. She gave the frog her ice cream. The frog ate the ice cream, and it was very happy. The frog then jumped off the road, and the traffic started moving again. Tom was so proud of Lisa, and he gave her a new ice cream. From that day on, the town loved Tom's ice cream even more, and they all became good friends with the big, green frog.

Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the cooler open. The dog and the girl saw that there was no food in the cooler. Instead, there were lots of toys! But then, something unexpected happened. The bee touched the ball and it changed colors! It turned from red to blue. The boy and the bee were very surprised.
